question.content: Select the most appropriate homonymtofillintheblanksofthegiven sentences. A.Iusea______toweighmyingredients while cooking. B. The mountaineer is going to _______ the rocky hills.

solution.content: scale In Sentence A, ‘scale’ refers to an instrument used to measuretheweight. In Sentence B, ‘scale’meanstoclimbor ascend, especially a rocky surface. ‘Scale’ makes both the sentences meaningful. Hence, ‘scale’ is the most appropriate answer.

question.content: Select the most appropriate homophone to fill in the blank. Even animals find itdifficultto_____the loss of their loved ones.  (1st Shift)

solution.content: bear ‘Bear’ means to accept something painfulorunpleasant.Thegivenpassage statesthatevenanimalsfinditdifficultto bearthelossoftheivedones.Hence, ‘bear’ is the most appropriate answer.

question.content: Select the most appropriate homophones to fill in the blanks. Kindly accept my ________ on your new haircut. It ________ your personality.  (2nd Shift)

solution.content: compliment ; complements ‘Compliment’ means to politely congratulateorpraise and‘complement’ means to enhance something. In the given sentence, the speaker is praising the new haircut, and it enhances the person'spersonality.Hence,‘compliment; complements’ is the most appropriate answer.

question.content: Select the most appropriate homonyminthecontextofthefollowing sentence to fill in the blank. My birthday will ____ on a Friday this year.  (4th Shift)

answer: fall: to come at a particular time or happen in a particular place

question.content: Select the most appropriate homophone to fill in the blank. Thedogtook_______duringhiswalkand lifted his _______toindicatethathewas tired.  (1st Shift)

solution.content: pause; paws ‘Pause’ means to temporarily stop and ‘paws’ is the soft, padded part of an animal’s feet. Thegivensentencestates that the dog stopped briefly during his walk and raiseditspawstoshowthatit was tired. Hence, ‘pause; paws’ is the most appropriate answer.

solution.content: vain ‘Vain’ means without success or producing no result.Thegivensentence states that the doctors used stronger drugs in the hope of the patient recovering, but it was unlikely to succeed. Hence, ‘vain’ is the most appropriate answer.

question.content: Select the most appropriate homophones to fill in the blanks. Hewascriticisedforthe______leadership of his team. His casual body language seemed ______ for a leader.  (3rd Shift)

solution.content: Inept; inapt ‘Inept’ means lacking skill or ability & ‘Inapt’meansnotsuitableorappropriate. The given sentence states that he was criticised for lacking skills ofleadership and his casual body language seemed inappropriate for a leader. Hence,‘inept; inapt’ is the most appropriate answer.

question.content: Select the most appropriate homophone to fill in the blank. Developers________ theoldbuildingson the site to make way for new construction.  (1st Shift)

question.content: Select the most appropriate meaning of thehomonyminthecontext of the following sentence to fill in the blank. They do not say anything but stalk furiously out of the room. 'Stalk' here means ________.  (2nd Shift)

to walk in an angry or proud way

question.content: Select the most appropriate homophone to fill in the blank. Iwill________anyjoboffer__________ for the one that requires me to work on weekends.  (4th Shift)

solution.content: accept; except ‘Modal verbs’ are auxiliary verbs(also calledhelpingverbs)likecan,will,could, shall, must, would, might, and should. However,afteramodalverb,wegenerally usethefirstformoftheverb(V 1 ).Hence, ‘accept (V 1 ); except ’ is the most appropriate answer.

solution.content: wrest ‘Wrest’ means to forcibly take or obtain something. The given sentence states that the shareholders are planning to forcibly take control of the company fromthecurrentdirectors.Hence,‘wrest’ is the most appropriate answer.

question.content: Identifytheoptionthatdefinesthe homonyms 'gate' and 'gait' most appropriately.  (2nd shift)

options.text: Gate means to achieve or receive, and gait means a person's manner of walking.
Gate means a hinged barrier used to close an opening in a wall, fence or hedge, and gait means a person's manner of walking.
Gate means general agreement on tariff and excise, and gait means a person's manner of talking.
Gate means a hinged barrier used to close an opening in a wall or fence, and gait means a cloth or leather leg covering reaching from the instep to above the ankle or to the mid-calf or knee.

answer: Gate means a hinged barrier used to close an opening in a wall, fence or hedge, and gait means a person's manner of walking.

solution.content: ‘Gate’ means ahingedbarrier used to close an opening in a wall or fence, and ‘Gait’ means a person's manner of walking.

question.content: Selectthenearesthomonymofthe given word. Accept  (3rd shift)

solution.content: Except ‘Homonyms’ are words that have the same spelling or pronunciation but different meanings. ‘Accept’ And ‘Expect’ are homonyms as they sound the same but have different meanings and spellings. Hence, ‘except’ is the most appropriate answer.
